name: Ska
description: Originated in Jamaica in the late 1950s, characterized by a signature off-beat rhythm (referred to as the ‘skank’ rhythm), chop-style guitar work, busy bass lines and a use of horn sections.

children.name: 2 Tone
children.description: Combines 1960s Jamaican Ska with Punk Rock and New Wave to create tracks played at faster tempos and with a harder edge than the original Jamaican records.

children.name: Jamaican Ska
children.description: Originated in Jamaica with groups who combined Jazz and Rhythm & Blues with rhythms of traditional Caribbean Music like Mento and Calypso.

children.name: New Tone
children.description: Musically and socio-politically progressive movement noted for combatting prejudices and mixing together different styles of music, such as Electronic, Hip Hop, or Emo.

children.name: Spouge
children.description: Fusion of Calypso and Ska originating in Barbados during the 1960s and 70s.

children.name: Third Wave Ska
children.description: Expanded on the 2 Tone period, adding further Rock elements resulting in a heavier sound.
